In y = a sin[b(x - c)] + d, what does each letter represent?
options: a: amplitude, b: period(2π/|b|), c: horizontal shift, d: vertical shift
a: period, b: amplitude, c: vertical shift, d: horizontal shift
a: vertical shift, b: horizontal shift, c: amplitude, d: period
a: horizontal shift, b: vertical shift, c: period, d: amplitude

front: How does 'a' affect y = a sin(x)?
options: Changes height to |a| units from midline

front: What happens when a is negative in y = a sin(x)?

options: Period, amplitude, horizontal shift, vertical shift
